identity.tagline: A thousand years of history for a timeless celebration
identity.short_description: A magnificent 12th century castle in the South of France, classified as a Monument Historique, offering exclusive privatisation for weddings of up to 220 guests with 55 sleeping on-site.

location.distance_to_coast: 40 minutes to the Mediterranean (Aigues-Mortes, La Grande-Motte)
location.landscape_description: Between the Mediterranean and the Cevennes, in the rolling garrigue landscape of the Gard

history.architectural_style: medieval fortified castle with Renaissance additions
history.historical_narrative: Founded in 1195 as a fortified castle, Chateau de Pondres has witnessed over 800 years of history. Originally a stronghold during the Albigensian Crusade, it was transformed into an elegant Renaissance residence in the 16th century. The property underwent a meticulous 10-year restoration under the aegis of the Conservation des Monuments Historiques, preserving its medieval towers, vaulted halls, and Renaissance courtyards while introducing modern comfort.
notable_architectural_features: Renaissance courtyard with sculpted stone balustrades
restored chapel with original 14th-century paintings and altar
history.renovation_history: 10-year restoration completed under the Conservation des Monuments Historiques, balancing historical preservation with modern amenity integration
literary_cultural_associations: Troubadour poetry tradition of the Languedoc

spaces.name: Cour d'Honneur
spaces.description: The majestic main courtyard, framed by the medieval towers and Renaissance facades, provides the dramatic heart of any celebration.

spaces.name: Salle des Repas
spaces.description: A former armoury, this beautiful vaulted room of 93m2 opens directly onto the Cour d'Honneur. Also serves as backup for secular ceremonies in case of rain.

spaces.name: Salle des Etats Generaux
spaces.description: The grand hall where the Estates General once convened, featuring a monumental stone fireplace and original painted beam ceiling.

spaces.name: Chapel
spaces.description: The restored castle chapel with original medieval paintings and consecrated altar, available for religious and symbolic ceremonies.

spaces.name: Les Jardins a la Francaise
spaces.description: Formal French gardens with geometric boxwood patterns, a central fountain, and sweeping views of the surrounding garrigue.

spaces.name: Pool Terrace
spaces.description: The poolside terrace overlooking the vineyards, ideal for next-day brunch or casual evening cocktails.

accommodation.mandatory_accommodation_details: Accommodation for all on-site bedrooms is included in the venue hire — all 55 sleeping places are reserved for the wedding party.
accommodation.bridal_suite_description: The Marquise Suite occupies the entire top floor of the medieval tower, featuring a king-size four-poster bed, freestanding bathtub, private terrace with panoramic views, and separate dressing room.
accommodation.preparation_rooms: Two separate preparation suites — one in the tower for the bride, one in the Renaissance wing for the groom, each with full-length mirrors, natural light, and en-suite facilities.

buildings.name: Le Chateau
buildings.description: The main castle building with rooms spanning the medieval tower and Renaissance wings. Each room features period furniture, stone walls, and modern en-suite bathrooms.

rooms.name: La Suite Marquise
rooms.bathroom_type: en-suite bath and shower with freestanding bathtub
rooms.view: Panoramic views over gardens and garrigue

buildings.name: Les Moulins
buildings.description: A converted stone mill house 50 metres from the chateau, offering 8 comfortable bedrooms with a shared kitchen, living area, and private garden.

buildings.name: La Maison des Bois
buildings.description: A charming stone cottage at the edge of the estate woodland, with 4 bedrooms, equipped kitchen, and covered terrace with barbecue.

accommodation.breakfast_details: Full French breakfast served in the Orangerie or on the courtyard terrace, featuring local pastries, cheeses, charcuterie, fresh fruits, and hot beverages.
nearby_accommodation: Hotel & Spa Nid de Cigognes (3-star, 10 minutes)

pricing.starting_price_description: Low season venue hire for 2 nights including accommodation for 55 guests, exclusive use, tables and chairs, and swimming pool access.
pricing.tourist_tax_note: Tourist tax (taxe de sejour) of 2.53 EUR per person per night, applicable from age 18, not included in venue hire price.

packages.name: Chateau Prestige
includes: Champagne reception with 8 canapes per person
3 glasses of regional wine (white, rose, red)
Tables, chairs, white linen tablecloths and napkins
Dedicated maitre d'hotel and service team
Tasting meal for the couple prior to the wedding

packages.name: Chateau Imperial
includes: Champagne reception with 12 premium canapes per person
6-course gastronomic dinner with amuse-bouche and pre-dessert
4 glasses of premium wine from Chateau la Dorgonne estate
Blanc de blanc champagne for toasts
Presentation wedding cake plus dessert buffet
Premium table art and floral centrepieces
Dedicated maitre d'hotel, sommelier, and full service team

pricing.rental_period_description: Friday 3PM to Sunday 6PM (2-night standard); extendable to 3 nights
pricing.cancellation_policy: 30% deposit non-refundable. Balance due 8 weeks before event. Cancellation within 8 weeks: 100% of total charged.
price_includes: Wedding coordinator on the day of the event

catering.cuisine_style: Refined traditional Mediterranean cuisine with local sourcing
catering.brunch_description: Sumptuous Sunday brunch served by the pool terrace or in the Orangerie, featuring local charcuterie, cheeses, pastries, fresh fruits, and Languedoc wines.
catering.wedding_cake: Arranged through chosen caterer or external patissier

drinks.bar_service_description: Full bar service available through caterer. No corkage fee — couples may bring their own champagne and wine.

vendor_rules.non_approved_vendor_fee: Non-listed caterers subject to 200 EUR kitchen inspection fee

ceremony.chapel_details: Restored castle chapel with original 14th-century paintings and consecrated altar, seating 40 guests for religious or symbolic ceremonies.
ceremony.nearby_church: Eglise de Villevieille, 5-minute walk from the chateau
outdoor_ceremony_locations: Cour d'Honneur under the plane trees
Les Jardins a la Francaise formal parterre
ceremony.rain_backup_plan: Salle des Repas (vaulted indoor hall) serves as backup for outdoor ceremonies

amenities.pool_details: Heated outdoor pool surrounded by planted stone walls, open May to October
amenities.spa_details: Pondres Nature wellness space with massage room, relaxation area, and curated treatments using local products
amenities.gardens_description: 15 hectares of formal French gardens, century-old plane trees, Mediterranean garrigue, vineyards, and planted courtyard with fountains and water features.
notable_trees: Centuries-old plane trees planted before the French Revolution

activities.fireworks_details: Professional fireworks display available through venue partner, launched from the gardens with views from the Cour d'Honneur.

technical.furniture_details: Round tables for 8 or 10 guests, gold chiavari chairs, standing cocktail tables, buffet tables. Additional rental options available through partner companies.
technical.climate_control: Reception rooms fully air-conditioned. Courtyard events benefit from natural stone cooling. Heating available for winter celebrations.

accessibility.accessibility_details: Full PMR accessibility throughout ground floor reception areas. Elevator access to upper floors. 2 accessible bedrooms with adapted bathrooms. Independent disabled parking area near entrance.

eco_practices: Local sourcing from short supply circuits
Partnership with regional olive oil, cheese, and seafood producers

parking.parking_type: Free private parking behind the chateau, screened from event areas

policies.noise_restrictions: Outdoor music until midnight. Indoor dancing in soundproofed hall until 3:00 AM. DJ or live band until the end of the night in the Salle des Etats Generaux.
policies.setup_access_time: Thursday 2PM for Friday weddings; decoration team access from 8AM on Friday
policies.teardown_deadline: Sunday 6PM — all external vendor equipment must be removed
policies.tent_marquee_policy: Marquees not permitted on the formal gardens. Stretch tent allowed on the lower meadow with prior approval.
policies.confetti_policy: Natural petals and dried lavender only. No paper, metallic, or plastic confetti.
policies.candle_policy: Real candles must be in holders and placed on non-flammable surfaces. Extinguished after dinner service. LED candles preferred in historic rooms.
policies.portable_toilets_policy: Required for events exceeding 150 guests with outdoor reception.
policies.security_guard_policy: Mandatory for events exceeding 150 guests or running past 1:00 AM.

contact.phone_hours: Monday to Saturday, 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM

wedding_day_details.typical_timeline: Ceremony around 5:00 PM in the gardens, cocktail hour at 6:00 PM in the Cour d'Honneur, seated dinner at 8:00 PM, party and dancing from 11:00 PM in the Salle des Etats Generaux.
wedding_day_details.typical_weekend_flow: Friday evening: welcome dinner for close family on the Pool Terrace. Saturday: bride and groom preparations, ceremony, cocktails, dinner, party. Sunday: late brunch by the pool, leisurely departure by 6:00 PM.
